meanings.definition: Covered with fuzz or a fuzzy substance.
meanings.sent1: The peach had a fuzzed skin.
meanings.sent2: The teddy bear's fur felt soft and fuzzed.
meanings.sent3: The fuzzy caterpillar looked cute and fuzzed.
meanings.sent4: The fog made the distant trees appear fuzzed.
meanings.sent5: The blanket was warm and fuzzed against my skin.

meanings.definition: To make something appear unclear or indistinct.
meanings.sent1: The camera lens fuzzed the image.
meanings.sent2: The steam from the kettle fuzzed the mirror.
meanings.sent3: The magician fuzzed the card to surprise the audience.
meanings.sent4: The artist fuzzed the edges of the painting for a dreamy effect.
meanings.sent5: The rain fuzzed the view through the window.

meanings.sent1: She fuzzed her thoughts when trying to solve the puzzle.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were so complicated that they fuzzed his mind.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up at the party fuzzed everyone's plans.
meanings.sent4: The overlapping voices fuzzed her understanding of the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The stress fuzzed his ability to focus on the task at hand.
